$I5.description: Another general-purpose int? (#5) Strangely, it's only used by photo games.

%RANDRAD.description: Draws a random value from -PI to PI using the animation RNG. You can modify this range by editing %RANDRADLIMIT.

%RANDF.description: Draws a random value from 0.0 to 1.0 using the animation RNG. You can modify this range by editing %RANDFLIMIT.

%RANDF2.description: Draws a random value from -1.0 to 1.0 using the animation RNG. You can modify this range by editing $RANDLIMIT.

%POS_X.description: Position x, as set by pos.

%POS_Y.description: Position y, as set by pos.

%POS_Z.description: Position z, as set by pos.

VAR_10016.name: [10016.0f]
VAR_10016.description: Stage BG camera's x position, plus some vector related to its rocking...

VAR_10017.name: [10017.0f]
VAR_10017.description: Stage BG camera's y position, plus some vector related to its rocking...

VAR_10018.name: [10018.0f]
VAR_10018.description: Stage BG camera's z position, plus some vector related to its rocking...

VAR_10019.name: [10019.0f]
VAR_10019.description: x of normalized direction vector that the stage BG camera is facing. (what is it used for?)

VAR_10020.name: [10020.0f]
VAR_10020.description: y of normalized direction vector that the stage BG camera is facing. (what is it used for?)

VAR_10021.name: [10021.0f]
VAR_10021.description: z of normalized direction vector that the stage BG camera is facing. (what is it used for?)

$RAND.description: Draws a random integer from 0 (inclusive) to 65536 (exclusive) using the animation RNG. You can modify this range by editing $RANDLIMIT.
